column2: Dúnadan]] and the brother of [[Baranor (video game character)
column3: Baranor]] and uncle of [[Eradan (video game character)
column4: Eradan]]. Although he doesn't make an actual appearance in [[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]], he is mentioned in the [http://www.warinthenorth.com/the-game/heroes/backstory#dunedainAnchor backstory of Eradan].<ref name="Backstory Eradan">{{webcite

column1: Dunhir's ancestors were members of a noble family from [[Númenor]], who were loyal to [[Elendil]]. After the [[Downfall of Númenor]] they went into exile to [[Middle-earth]] and served the [[Kings of Arnor
column2: heirs of Elendil]] in [[Arnor]]. He was a [[Rangers of the North
column3: Ranger]] and served [[Aragorn]]. After the death of [[Baranor (video game character)
column4: Baranor]], he fostered Baranor's son, Eradan, and oversaw his training.<ref name="Backstory Eradan"/>
